instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Macbook Pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Logic Board with No Boot. Does have Green Light & Fan Spin
threads.message:
Hello everyone, I am somewhat new to board repair. I can diagnose and repair certain power / back light issues on macbooks, ipads, iphones etc. but am still learning how to use schematics and multi-meter to efficiently diagnose and repair less common problems.

I have this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board here for example with no boot. Does have Green Light & Fan Spin (Gradually gets louder and louder until it sounds like an airplane).

This machines did receive light amount of water damage about a week before it started doing this.

* There is no visible corrosion, there are some red probe points around the board.

* I did notice that <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> gets very hot.

* I checked certain power rails and they seemed to be normal. 

* I have multiple known good boards for testing.

I am mostly wondering (based on these symptoms) where I should start and why.

Would be very grateful if someone going point me in the right direction - thank you!

threads.title: Macbook Pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Logic Board with No Boot. Does have Green Light & Fan Spin
threads.message:
<CHIP>U3900</CHIP> getting hot can very well keep the board from booting. But how hot is hot? If it is finger burning hot then the chip is dead at least. It is only LAN chip so can be removed and board will still work.

There is the problem as to how this chip got killed and a voltage spike is one of them, it is not such a good start, high chance of extensive fried chips.
